intro: Homocolleticon submontana, commonly known as the mountain pygmyweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive, triangular leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid and semi-arid environments. It is a perennial herb that produces tiny, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its low water requirements, it is often used in xeriscaping and restoration projects in dry landscapes.
